reviews.text: MY room was infested with bedbugs, which the exterminator treated. I continued to be bitten because there was no recommended follow-up treatment as outlined by the professional. This is when the impervious eggs began to hatch and start the cycle over again. They offered to move me to another room (no guarantee bug free) with all my already contaminated luggage and clothing, rather than spend money for professional treatment. They also house two legged pests with TB, parolees, drug and alcohol patients, mentally defectives sponsored by the County.
reviews.title: It should be called the 500 Pest!

reviews.text: well it is a YMCA. Nice, well located, cheap, confortable, If you want top brand this is not for you (but you should know !!!) if you want the a place where to rest it is more than OK.
reviews.title: good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I choose a room with shared baths and they were really clean. The breakfast is not included.
reviews.title: Clean, Neat, Fantastic Front Desk Staff.

reviews.text: Internet available in a pay mode.
reviews.title: A Great Find!! We returned for a second stay!!!

reviews.text: Really close to the Amtrak station. Safe. What you need more ?
reviews.title: Horrible bed bugs night after night...

reviews.text: Even this "hotel" advertises itself as a "hotel/hostel." If you prepare yourself to stay in a hostel, you will be significantly less disappointed. Just ignore the homeless people loitering in front of the place, and don't count on the elevators working....just take the stairs and save yourself the aggravation.
reviews.title: If you realize you are staying in a hostel, you'll be less disappointed.

reviews.text: The location cannot be beat for $40 a night. It is within walking distance to the wharf, cruise ship terminal, gas lamp district, and located right between the train station and Greyhound.
reviews.title: I loved it! But is it the Right Place for You? A review with a few helpful hints...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would probably stay there again, but only if I was alone...would not take my wife of children.
reviews.title: Rude staff

reviews.text: Review on 500 West Hotel
reviews.title: Flop--- House Hotel/Hostel

reviews.text: 500 West Broadway
reviews.title: OH MY!!

reviews.text: Earlier reviews have mentioned infestations. But I have stayed here many times over the last three years and I have not found this to be the case. Yes, the doors tend to have a fast close rate and you should be sure to check the close. It is good for you since you know the door will shut. And Yes, it is downtown, so there are an unwanted transient presence. But that presence is the same for the Weston on the next block as well as the Sofia and US Grant a little further down on Broadway. Hey, if you are worried about the transients and drug use - on the other side of Broadway from the US Grant at the Horton Plaza, you an watch their activities. As well as take bets on when and if the local police will intervene. No actually, San Diego does it's best to keep the downtown and gas lamp area safe. ALSO PLEASE be aware that this is a shared bathroom establishment. And YES, they do keep them clean. But this review is from a MALE solo traveler. I do not find any issues with this hostel and I have always received good service. If you want to keep you possessions in any shared area, please be aware that there are thieves, no matter what you pay for boarding and where you stay.
reviews.title: Yes - it is a hostel, but the location is great

reviews.text: I do recommend this hostel as a no-frills stay - in the heart of San Diego and a short bus ride to SAN airport. To tell the truth, I look forward to seeing San Diego and the staff this Friday.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs

reviews.text: Some weeks after I came home, my apartment was infested with bed bugs, and I am sure they came from this place. Now my life is pretty ruined and I have to get rid of a lot of my possessions. DO NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE OR YOU RISK A BED BUG OUTBREAK IN YOUR HOME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Its a hostel

reviews.text: I read about the bedbugs, so I bought a $8 can of spray from WalGreens and sprayed the sides of the bed and spent a comfortable night.
reviews.title: Bed bugs!!!

reviews.text: I was guilty of banging my room door when leaving - it shuts hard unless you watch it.
reviews.title: THE PRICE IS RIGHT!

reviews.text: I agree with the positive reviewers -- realize that you're in a hostel, basically a YMCA environment, and you'll be fine. Considering the number of transients and all, the place was pretty well maintained. I was especially happy with the staff who corrected any problems I had quickly and were cooperative with check-in and luggage. To a bad reviewer, yeah, the doors do slam sometimes. Learn to observe and be respectful of others and you'll be fine. The shared bathrooms did get overcrowded at times and a long wait, but it was Comicon time and so the place was packed. If you want luxury, go across the street to the Westin and spend $200 more a night. Only recommended for solo travellers as the rooms are about the size of a large closet. Cute little TV set and a closet and table. Even a bible in the drawer. The adjoining cafe is a hit-or-miss place -- let the persons know you're there or else you could be sitting around for some time before a waitress notices you! Just sayin'.
reviews.title: Great Location, Just Plan To Be Out A Lot!

reviews.text: i live in guest prevented me from closing my door to call the front desk. he was mad because i let my door swing shut when i leave or enter my room...and he thinks its too loud. the FRONT DESK, and the manager TOM CARTWRIGHT refused to do anything for me even though i didnt make a huge stink while i was there, and did not call the police against the guy that was barging into my paid for room, and giving me cause for concern.
reviews.title: Invasion of privacy, and no protection
Great for those on a budget (i.e. young...
reviews.text: Great for those on a budget (i.e. young college students). Many foreign visitors there, making for a fun atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed there for 3 nights in July. We like the price and the location. In fact, the location really is amazing, you are close to absolutely everything, you are 10-15 minutes walk from all major attractions. The rooms are EXTREMLY small, two luggages and the door did not close anymore. Very "hostel" like, shared bathrooms is with over 15 people, so it kind of sucks. But I was amazed at how clean the bathrooms were for the amount of people going in and out all the time. The hotel is pretty clean, the gym is very big (5$ per visit), the restaurant has great breakfasts and lunches. All in all, it's very good value for money. You don't pay much, and that's why you get the tiny room and shared bathroom. But if you can live with that, the rest is pretty good. If you're looking for nice, cozy, don't go there. But if you just want a place to crash for a few days, it's perfect, and cheap!
reviews.title: You get exactly what you pay for

reviews.text: I don't get the negative reviews... unless they are simply being written by people without the means to get online and read. This is not a hotel - OK, so probably not even a "Hybrid" as they call it.
reviews.title: It's Not The Ritz, But You Can't Beat The Price or Location
